title: Part 2: R workflows for reproducible spatial analysis
text:
About


app-dev-gis
Course materials for the Application Development Course (GIS) - R module

title: Part 2: R workflows for reproducible spatial analysis
Practical 0 - Getting Started with R
text:
Self-paced introduction to R
In this course you will learn the very basics of R, from installation, working with files and projects to loading and exploring your first dataset in R. It should take you around 1h30 to 2h to complete the course.

title: Practical 0 - Getting Started with R
text:
Go to the following link in R for the Rest of Us - Getting Started with R.
Please register to the course as indicated. This introductory course is free of charge.
By the end of the course you should receive a certificate. Upload the certificate to the Blackboard Assignment.

title: Practical 0 - Getting Started with R
text:
Interactively learn R with swirl
If you went through the fundamentals of R faster than you expected, feel free to learn or freshen up your R basics interactively via the swirl package.

Go to the swirl website
Follow the instructions to start interactive R courses from the R console.

You can skip steps 1 and 2, since you did this already in the course above.

Check Step 5 for instructions to download more courses, in different languages available at the Swirl Course Network.

This part of the practical is optional and you don’t need to prove completion. I do recommend you to test a couple of swirl modules though since we will get full hands-on in the next session.
